body: @devosend fix bug in https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/pull/10937#discussion_r932799027 review.  PTAL

> Hi @guodongym , Thx for contributing this great feature! It seems there is no related docs for this PR, could you please add the docs? Thx again.

Yes I can

> > I think it's not a good idea to support windows. Since many big data components do not support running on windows...
> 
> I just worry this may introduce new bugs, and once we announce ds support windows, we may need to fix more and more windows bugs...

This is also one of the points to be considered. There are many incompatibilities between Windows and Linux. For example, the current E2E does not support running in windows...

@lyleshaw Please add a issue to target this PR, BTW, can we add some separate function from `create` and `update` function? I have do the same thing in Tenant and Queue https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/78e912257330c8ec488df7d42e025f47e15331c9/dolphinscheduler-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/api/service/impl/QueueServiceImpl.java#L70-L110

Thank you for your feedback, we have received your issue, Please wait patiently for a reply.
* In order for us to understand your request as soon as possible, please provide detailed information„ÄÅversion or pictures.
* If you haven't received a reply for a long time, you can [join our slack](https://s.apache.org/dolphinscheduler-slack) and send your question to channel `#troubleshooting`

Thanks for your answers. Indeed, windows environment may bring many unknown problems. but during our production, some worker actuators need to be executed under windows, such as some collection servers in the banking system are windows;

Thank you for your feedback, we have received your issue, Please wait patiently for a reply.
* In order for us to understand your request as soon as possible, please provide detailed information„ÄÅversion or pictures.
* If you haven't received a reply for a long time, you can [join our slack](https://s.apache.org/dolphinscheduler-slack) and send your question to channel `#troubleshooting`

Actually we could keep both `Spotless` and `Checkstyle` as long as we make the requirements of those two compatible. We will use `Spotless` for fixing style errors automatically and use `Checkstyle` in CI for double-check.

> I re-test it, and find there are two error places > > 1. workflow definition -> Edit task -> select environment name > > > > 2. workflow definition -> mark workflow online -> trigger -> select environment name > > Have you selected a worker group for the environment? If not, the worker group of the environment list from the back end should be set to default not empty. @zhongjiajie pls cc.

> Actually we could keep both `Spotless` and `Checkstyle` as long as we make the requirements of those two compatible. We will use `Spotless` for fixing style errors automatically and use `Checkstyle` in CI for double-check.

AFAIK. `Apache ShardingSphere` is using this method, FYI:

https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/blob/19265081c966cb0a839267b060593b258b0883b4/pom.xml#L1001-L1045

https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/tree/master/src/resources

Also here is a related instructions written in Chinese:

https://shardingsphere.apache.org/blog/cn/material/spotless/
Some updates, see: https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/pull/11272#issuecomment-1203511210
@ruanwenjun ok i'll close this
@SbloodyS @caishunfeng  PTAL, thx.

> > I re-test it, and find there are two error places > > > > 1. workflow definition -> Edit task -> select environment name > > > > > > > > 2. workflow definition -> mark workflow online -> trigger -> select environment name > > > > > > Have you selected a worker group for the environment? If not, the worker group of the environment list from the back end should be set to default not empty. @zhongjiajie pls cc. Yesh, you are right I forget to connect the environment to workgroup, when I connect them then it work correctly, thanks for your clarification üëç
cc @EricGao888

> > I re-test it, and find there are two error places > > > > 1. workflow definition -> Edit task -> select environment name > > > > > > > > 2. workflow definition -> mark workflow online -> trigger -> select environment name > > > > > > Have you selected a worker group for the environment? If not, the worker group of the environment list from the back end should be set to default not empty. @zhongjiajie pls cc. @Amy0104 @zhongjiajie Thanks for the clarification. `Environments` works for me after associating it with `worker group`. My bad and I think I need to reread the docs : ). BTW, I still have the issue with `alarm groups`, do I miss anything here?

Do you have any good idea? AFAIK, we can use xx task SDK to submit task, and can get the appId from SDK, then we don't need to parse from log. Or we can optimize the currently `parse` method to avoid OOM.

> I think `putMsg` and `Exception` are two different behaviors. We use `putMsg` to return valid error messages through API, while exceptions will not be returned through API.

I have discuss with @caishunfeng , we think `putMsg` it is redundant and we should throw exception directly in serviceImpl, So we add a new `ExceptionHandler` in https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/ae6aa53f963d2ea02ab435db1e5548da23e3f882/dolphinscheduler-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/api/exceptions/ApiExceptionHandler.java#L39-L43 from api side, which will covert the `ServiceException` to `Result` object, and return in `controller`. And we already have some existing code in https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/ae6aa53f963d2ea02ab435db1e5548da23e3f882/dolphinscheduler-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/api/service/impl/TenantServiceImpl.java#L94-L105

And @SbloodyS do you think it is a good idea about this change? @SbloodyS
That make sense to me. And it's a big project to modify it. I suggest mark it as a `DSIP` and make a todo list just as we do in #10257. WDYT? @zhongjiajie
fix in #11271
I will update this issue with a more detailed refactoring plan as well as priorities later this week.

> > I think `putMsg` and `Exception` are two different behaviors. We use `putMsg` to return valid error messages through API, while exceptions will not be returned through API.
> 
> I have discuss with @caishunfeng , we think `putMsg` it is redundant and we should throw exception directly in serviceImpl, So we add a new `ExceptionHandler` in
> 
> https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/ae6aa53f963d2ea02ab435db1e5548da23e3f882/dolphinscheduler-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/api/exceptions/ApiExceptionHandler.java#L39-L43
> 
> from api side, which will covert the `ServiceException` to `Result` object, and return in `controller`. And we already have some existing code in
> https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/ae6aa53f963d2ea02ab435db1e5548da23e3f882/dolphinscheduler-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/api/service/impl/TenantServiceImpl.java#L94-L105
> 
> And @SbloodyS do you think it is a good idea about this change? @SbloodyS

+1Ôºå make sense to me, `Result` is usually only used as a standard data format for external system interaction.

> This has been implement in #9177 . I'll close this issue.

@SbloodyS Looks like #9177 enables users to write multiple lines of mysql but still not support users to write multiple lines of hive sql. Maybe we could reopen this issue?

> @ruanwenjun Yeh, maybe a practicable solution, we can simply talk about it.
> 
> Before submitting a yarn job, the client apply the application context from RM first, and get appId which will be then written into NM's environment variable. We can use java agent to read it before executing yarn job's JAR file, also, can take taskInstanceId as input of agent program. However, where to store this mapping relationship need to be further considered.
> 
> Please let me know if you have any good suggestions!

In fact, there is already a issue(#4025) talk about use agent to collect the appId, but I think it isn't a good way üò¢ , we need to maintain a agent and we may need to maintain different version agant.

> does we will totally remove table `t_ds_resource` in the end?

In the end, yes. But for now, we will keep it for backward compatibility. A new table `t_ds_relation_resources_task` is dedicated to storing resources used by tasks in online workflows.
